TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit ISOWeek extends System.Object
public ref class ISOWeek abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Provides static members to support the ISO week date that is part of the ISO 8601 date and time standard issued by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig int32 GetWeekOfYear(valuetype System.DateTime date) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetWeekOfYear (date As DateTime) As Integer

Docs.param: A date in the Gregorian calendar.
Docs.summary: Calculates the ISO week number of a given Gregorian date.
Docs.returns: A number between 1 and 53 represnting the ISO week number of the given Gregorian date.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The returned ISO week number can belong to an ISO year that is different from the input Gregorian year. For example, the Gregorian date 2005-01-01 will have ISO week number 53 but ISO year 2004.
To get the ISO week-numbering year (also called the ISO year informally), call <xref:System.Globalization.ISOWeek.GetYear(System.DateTime)>

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig int32 GetWeeksInYear(int32 year) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetWeeksInYear (year As Integer) As Integer

Docs.param: An ISO week-numbering year (also called an ISO year informally).
Docs.summary: calculates the number of weeks in a given ISO week-numbering year.
Docs.returns: The number of ISO weeks in the year. Returns either 52 or 53.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig int32 GetYear(valuetype System.DateTime date) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetYear (date As DateTime) As Integer

Docs.param: A date in the Gregorian calendar.
Docs.summary: Calculates the ISO week-numbering year (also called ISO year informally) mapped to the input Gregorian date.
Docs.returns: The ISO week-numbering year, between 1 and 9999

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ISO week-numbering year number mapping to Gregorian date can be different than the year of the given Gregorian. or example, the Gregorian date 2005-01-01 maps to the ISO week-numbering year 2004.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig valuetype System.DateTime GetYearEnd(int32 year) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetYearEnd (year As Integer) As DateTime

Docs.param: An ISO week-numbering year (also called an ISO year informally).
Docs.summary: Calculates the Gregorian date at which the week-numbering year will end.
Docs.returns: The Gregorian date at which the week-numbering year will end.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig valuetype System.DateTime GetYearStart(int32 year) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetYearStart (year As Integer) As DateTime

Docs.param: An ISO week-numbering year (also called an ISO year informally).
Docs.summary: Calculates the Gregorian date at which the week-numbering year will start.
Docs.returns: The Gregorian date at which the week-numbering year will start.

MemberSignature.Value: public static DateTime ToDateTime (int year, int week, DayOfWeek dayOfWeek);
.method public static hidebysig valuetype System.DateTime ToDateTime(int32 year, int32 week, valuetype System.DayOfWeek dayOfWeek) cil managed
public: static DateTime ToDateTime(int year, int week, DayOfWeek dayOfWeek);
static member ToDateTime : int * int * DayOfWeek -> DateTime

Docs.param: An ISO week-numbering year (also called an ISO year informally).
The ISO week number in the given ISO week-numbering year.
The day of week inside the given ISO week.
Docs.summary: Maps the ISO week date represented by a specified ISO year, week number, and day of week to the equivalent Gregorian date.
Docs.returns: The Gregorian date equivalent to the input ISO week date.
